title: 2000/112/EC: Commission Decision of 14 January 2000 detailing the distribution between antigen banks of antigen reserves established within the framework of the Community action concerning reserves of foot-and-mouth disease vaccines and amending Commission Decisions 93/590/EC and 97/348/EC (notified under document number C(2000) 1) (Text with EEA relevance)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION
of 14 January 2000
detailing the distribution between antigen banks of antigen reserves established within the framework of the Community action concerning reserves of foot-and-mouth disease vaccines and amending Commission Decisions 93/590/EC and 97/348/EC
(notified under document number C(2000) 1)
(Text with EEA relevance)
(2000/112/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The quantities and types of antigen stored within the framework of Community reserves of foot-and-mouth disease antigen shall be distributed between designated antigen banks in accordance with the provisions in the Annex.

1. Article 3 of Decision 93/590/EC is repealed.
2. Article 5 of Decision 97/348/EC is repealed.
This Decision shall apply from 1 February 2000.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 14 January 2000.
For the Commission
David BYRNE
Member of the Commission
